intro: Oenothera torreyi, commonly known as the Torrey's evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that open in the evening and close by dawn. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in sandy or rocky soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. Oenothera torreyi is part of the Onagraceae family and is known for its ecological importance to pollinators like moths and beetles.
